metadata.title: Tuesday, 3rd March, 2020
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE TWELFTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a) whether the Government has any plans to lift the ban on night travel by public service vehicles;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented;
(c) if there are no such plans, why; and
(d) whether the Government is aware that the ban on night travel has adversely affected the businesses of small scale entrepreneurs.
(a) whether there are any women empowerment programmes being implemented in Zambezi West Parliamentary Constituency;
(b) if so, what type of programmes are being implemented;
(c) how many women clubs benefited from the programmes in 2017 and 2018; and
(d) what the total cost of the programmes was.
(a) what plans the Government has for the infrastructure at the former Serenje District Hospital site; and
(b) when the plans will be implemented.
(a) when the Government will facilitate the construction of communication towers in the following areas in Manyinga Parliamentary Constituency:
(i) Dyambombola; and (ii) Ndunga; and
(b) when the newly constructed tower at Kachikenge Primary School will become operational.

questions.minister: Minister of Housing and Infrastructure Development
parts: (a) when the grading of the Senga Hill - Chinakila road will commence;
(b) why the road has not been maintained for the past three (3) years;
(c) whether the Government has any plans to tar the road; and
(d) if so, when the plans will be implemented.
(a) whether the Government has any plans to rehabilitate Sokontwe Primary School in Milenge District;
(b) if so, when the plans will be implemented; and

(c) if there are no such plans, why. NOTICE OF MOTION Dr Kalila Report of the Committee on Health, Community Development and Social Services: That this House do adopt the Report of the Committee on Health, Community Development and Social Services on the Report of the Auditor General on the Social Cash Transfer in Zambia for the period 2014 to 2017, for the Fourth Session of the Twelfth National Assembly, laid on the Table of the House on Thursday, 27th February, 2020. __________________________
